summary: These are ways to mark years on the Gregorian calendar, which most of the world uses. CE means "Common Era" and BCE means "Before the Common Era." They are like the older terms AD ("Anno Domini," or "In the Year of our Lord") and BC ("Before Christ"), but are more neutral and don't refer to religious figures. People started using CE and BCE in the 17th century, and they became popular in the 19th and 20th centuries, especially in academic writing, to be respectful of different beliefs.
title: Common Era
